parallel.distributed

Class DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt

  • public class DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt
extends java.lang.Object
    class implementing clients for message-passing between threads living in distributed JVMs. A thread wishing to send or receive a message to another thread (in the same or different JVM), invokes the sendData() or recvData() methods of this class which behave exactly as the shared-memory analogue in class parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator. This class maintains one socket per object, so multiple threads requiring simultaneous access to the server should create their own client objects to avoid having to lock waiting for others to finish (all methods in this class are synchronized).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt()
      default constructor assumes the coordinator server lives in the same host (localhost) listening in port 7895, and the name of the coordinator is "DMsgPassingCoordinator_7895".
      DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String coordName)
      constructor specifies the host and port where the msg passing coordinator server lives, and also the name of the coordinator with whom all sends and receives will coordinate.

      close the (long-lived) socket connection.

      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.

      works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable.

      • DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt

        public DActiveMsgPassingCoordinatorLongLivedConnClt(java.lang.String host,
                                            int port,
                                            java.lang.String coordName)
                                             throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                    java.io.IOException
        constructor specifies the host and port where the msg passing coordinator server lives, and also the name of the coordinator with whom all sends and receives will coordinate.
        Parameters:
        host - String
        port - int
        coordName - String name of the coordinator instance in the server, to be used by threads sending and receiving msgs. Notice that it's possible for the same server to coordinate many different threads and processes via different names.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
            int toid,
            java.io.Serializable data)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                     ParallelException
        works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable. If the data is an instance of DMsgIntf, the data itself is transmitted, rather than a DSendMsg object.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        toid - int
        data - Serializable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ParallelException

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
            java.io.Serializable data)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                     ParallelException
        works exactly as the corresponding method with same signature in parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, except that the data must be serializable. Also, if the data is a DMsgIntf object, the object itself is sent (so as to be executed) rather than a DSendMsg wrapper object.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        data - Serializable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        ParallelException
